00048     [Serializable]
00049     public class EigenvalueDecomposition
00050     {
00052         int n;
00053 
00055         bool isSymmetric;
00056 
00058         double[] d, e;
00059 
00061         double[][] V;
00062 
00064         double[][] H;
00065 
00066         ComplexVector _eigenValues;
00067         Vector _eigenValuesReal;
00068         Vector _eigenValuesImag;
00069 
00070         [NonSerialized()]
00071         double cdivr, cdivi;
00072 
00073         OnDemandComputation<Matrix> _blockDiagonalOnDemand;
00074         OnDemandComputation<Matrix> _eigenVectorsOnDemand;
00075         OnDemandComputation<ComplexVector> _eigenValuesOnDemand;
00076 
00082         public
00083         EigenvalueDecomposition(
00084             Matrix Arg
00085             )
00086         {
00087             double[][] A = Arg;
00088             n = Arg.ColumnCount;
00089             V = Matrix.CreateMatrixData(n, n);
00090             d = new double[n];
00091             e = new double[n];
00092 
00093             isSymmetric = true;
00094             for(int j = 0; (j < n) & isSymmetric; j++)
00095             {
00096                 for(int i = 0; (i < n) & isSymmetric; i++)
00097                 {
00098                     isSymmetric &= (A[i][j] == A[j][i]);
00099                 }
00100             }
00101 
00102             if(isSymmetric)
00103             {
00104                 for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00105                 {
00106                     for(int j = 0; j < n; j++)
00107                     {
00108                         V[i][j] = A[i][j];
00109                     }
00110                 }
00111 
00112                 SymmetricTridiagonalize();
00113 
00114                 SymmetricDiagonalize();
00115             }
00116             else
00117             {
00118                 H = new double[n][];
00119                 for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00120                 {
00121                     double[] Hi = new double[n];
00122                     double[] Ai = A[i];
00123 
00124                     for(int j = 0; j < n; j++)
00125                     {
00126                         Hi[j] = Ai[j];
00127                     }
00128 
00129                     H[i] = Hi;
00130                 }
00131 
00132                 NonsymmetricReduceToHessenberg();
00133 
00134                 NonsymmetricReduceHessenberToRealSchur();
00135             }
00136 
00137             _eigenValuesReal = new Vector(d);
00138             _eigenValuesImag = new Vector(e);
00139             _eigenValues = ComplexVector.Create(d, e);
00140 
00141             InitOnDemandComputations();
00142         }
00143 
00148         public
00149         EigenvalueDecomposition(
00150             double[] d,
00151             double[] e
00152             )
00153         {
00154             // TODO: unit test missing for EigenvalueDecomposition constructor.
00155 
00156             n = d.Length;
00157             V = Matrix.CreateMatrixData(n, n);
00158 
00159             this.d = new double[n];
00160             Array.Copy(d, 0, this.d, 0, n);
00161 
00162             this.e = new double[n];
00163             Array.Copy(e, 0, this.e, 1, n - 1);
00164 
00165             for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00166             {
00167                 V[i][i] = 1;
00168             }
00169 
00170             SymmetricDiagonalize();
00171 
00172             _eigenValuesReal = new Vector(this.d);
00173             _eigenValuesImag = new Vector(this.e);
00174             _eigenValues = ComplexVector.Create(this.d, this.e);
00175 
00176             InitOnDemandComputations();
00177         }
00178

00222         void
00223         InitOnDemandComputations()
00224         {
00225             _blockDiagonalOnDemand = new OnDemandComputation<Matrix>(ComputeBlockDiagonalMatrix);
00226             _eigenValuesOnDemand = new OnDemandComputation<ComplexVector>(ComputeEigenValues);
00227             _eigenVectorsOnDemand = new OnDemandComputation<Matrix>(ComputeEigentVectors);
00228         }
00229 
00230         ComplexVector
00231         ComputeEigenValues()
00232         {
00233             Complex[] eigenvalues = new Complex[n];
00234 
00235             for(int i = 0; i < eigenvalues.Length; i++)
00236             {
00237                 eigenvalues[i] = new Complex(d[i], e[i]);
00238             }
00239 
00240             return new ComplexVector(eigenvalues);
00241         }
00242 
00243         Matrix
00244         ComputeBlockDiagonalMatrix()
00245         {
00246             double[][] D = Matrix.CreateMatrixData(n, n);
00247             for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00248             {
00249                 for(int j = 0; j < n; j++)
00250                 {
00251                     D[i][j] = 0.0;
00252                 }
00253 
00254                 D[i][i] = d[i];
00255 
00256                 if(e[i] > 0)
00257                 {
00258                     D[i][i + 1] = e[i];
00259                 }
00260                 else if(e[i] < 0)
00261                 {
00262                     D[i][i - 1] = e[i];
00263                 }
00264             }
00265 
00266             return new Matrix(D);
00267         }
00268 
00269         Matrix
00270         ComputeEigentVectors()
00271         {
00272             return new Matrix(V);
00273         }
00274 
00278         void
00279         SymmetricTridiagonalize()
00280         {
00281             // This is derived from the Algol procedures tred2 by
00282             // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
00283             // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
00284             // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
00285 
00286             for(int j = 0; j < n; j++)
00287             {
00288                 d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
00289             }
00290 
00291             // Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
00292 
00293             for(int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--)
00294             {
00295                 // Scale to avoid under/overflow.
00296 
00297                 double scale = 0.0;
00298                 double h = 0.0;
00299 
00300                 for(int k = 0; k < i; k++)
00301                 {
00302                     scale = scale + Math.Abs(d[k]);
00303                 }
00304 
00305                 if(scale == 0.0)
00306                 {
00307                     e[i] = d[i - 1];
00308                     for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
00309                     {
00310                         d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
00311                         V[i][j] = 0.0;
00312                         V[j][i] = 0.0;
00313                     }
00314                 }
00315                 else
00316                 {
00317                     // Generate Householder vector.
00318 
00319                     for(int k = 0; k < i; k++)
00320                     {
00321                         d[k] /= scale;
00322                         h += d[k] * d[k];
00323                     }
00324 
00325                     double f = d[i - 1];
00326                     double g = Math.Sqrt(h);
00327                     if(f > 0)
00328                     {
00329                         g = -g;
00330                     }
00331 
00332                     e[i] = scale * g;
00333                     h = h - f * g;
00334                     d[i - 1] = f - g;
00335                     for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
00336                     {
00337                         e[j] = 0.0;
00338                     }
00339 
00340                     // Apply similarity transformation to remaining columns.
00341 
00342                     for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
00343                     {
00344                         f = d[j];
00345                         V[j][i] = f;
00346                         g = e[j] + V[j][j] * f;
00347 
00348                         for(int k = j + 1; k <= i - 1; k++)
00349                         {
00350                             g += V[k][j] * d[k];
00351                             e[k] += V[k][j] * f;
00352                         }
00353 
00354                         e[j] = g;
00355                     }
00356 
00357                     f = 0.0;
00358 
00359                     for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
00360                     {
00361                         e[j] /= h;
00362                         f += e[j] * d[j];
00363                     }
00364 
00365                     double hh = f / (h + h);
00366 
00367                     for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
00368                     {
00369                         e[j] -= hh * d[j];
00370                     }
00371 
00372                     for(int j = 0; j < i; j++)
00373                     {
00374                         f = d[j];
00375                         g = e[j];
00376 
00377                         for(int k = j; k <= i - 1; k++)
00378                         {
00379                             V[k][j] -= (f * e[k] + g * d[k]);
00380                         }
00381 
00382                         d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
00383                         V[i][j] = 0.0;
00384                     }
00385                 }
00386 
00387                 d[i] = h;
00388             }
00389 
00390             // Accumulate transformations.
00391 
00392             for(int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++)
00393             {
00394                 V[n - 1][i] = V[i][i];
00395                 V[i][i] = 1.0;
00396                 double h = d[i + 1];
00397                 if(h != 0.0)
00398                 {
00399                     for(int k = 0; k <= i; k++)
00400                     {
00401                         d[k] = V[k][i + 1] / h;
00402                     }
00403 
00404                     for(int j = 0; j <= i; j++)
00405                     {
00406                         double g = 0.0;
00407                         for(int k = 0; k <= i; k++)
00408                         {
00409                             g += V[k][i + 1] * V[k][j];
00410                         }
00411 
00412                         for(int k = 0; k <= i; k++)
00413                         {
00414                             V[k][j] -= g * d[k];
00415                         }
00416                     }
00417                 }
00418 
00419                 for(int k = 0; k <= i; k++)
00420                 {
00421                     V[k][i + 1] = 0.0;
00422                 }
00423             }
00424 
00425             for(int j = 0; j < n; j++)
00426             {
00427                 d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
00428                 V[n - 1][j] = 0.0;
00429             }
00430 
00431             V[n - 1][n - 1] = 1.0;
00432             e[0] = 0.0;
00433         }
00434 
00438         void
00439         SymmetricDiagonalize()
00440         {
00441             // This is derived from the Algol procedures tql2, by
00442             // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
00443             // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
00444             // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
00445 
00446             for(int i = 1; i < n; i++)
00447             {
00448                 e[i - 1] = e[i];
00449             }
00450 
00451             e[n - 1] = 0.0;
00452 
00453             double f = 0.0;
00454             double tst1 = 0.0;
00455             double eps = Number.PositiveRelativeAccuracy;
00456             for(int l = 0; l < n; l++)
00457             {
00458                 // Find small subdiagonal element
00459 
00460                 tst1 = Math.Max(tst1, Math.Abs(d[l]) + Math.Abs(e[l]));
00461                 int m = l;
00462                 while(m < n)
00463                 {
00464                     if(Math.Abs(e[m]) <= eps * tst1)
00465                     {
00466                         break;
00467                     }
00468 
00469                     m++;
00470                 }
00471 
00472                 // If m == l, d[l] is an eigenvalue,
00473                 // otherwise, iterate.
00474 
00475                 if(m > l)
00476                 {
00477                     int iter = 0;
00478                     do
00479                     {
00480                         iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
00481 
00482                         // Compute implicit shift
00483 
00484                         double g = d[l];
00485                         double p = (d[l + 1] - g) / (2.0 * e[l]);
00486                         double r = Fn.Hypot(p, 1.0);
00487                         if(p < 0)
00488                         {
00489                             r = -r;
00490                         }
00491 
00492                         d[l] = e[l] / (p + r);
00493                         d[l + 1] = e[l] * (p + r);
00494 
00495                         double dl1 = d[l + 1];
00496                         double h = g - d[l];
00497                         for(int i = l + 2; i < n; i++)
00498                         {
00499                             d[i] -= h;
00500                         }
00501 
00502                         f = f + h;
00503 
00504                         // Implicit QL transformation.
00505 
00506                         p = d[m];
00507                         double c = 1.0;
00508                         double c2 = c;
00509                         double c3 = c;
00510                         double el1 = e[l + 1];
00511                         double s = 0.0;
00512                         double s2 = 0.0;
00513                         for(int i = m - 1; i >= l; i--)
00514                         {
00515                             c3 = c2;
00516                             c2 = c;
00517                             s2 = s;
00518                             g = c * e[i];
00519                             h = c * p;
00520                             r = Fn.Hypot(p, e[i]);
00521                             e[i + 1] = s * r;
00522                             s = e[i] / r;
00523                             c = p / r;
00524                             p = c * d[i] - s * g;
00525                             d[i + 1] = h + s * (c * g + s * d[i]);
00526 
00527                             // Accumulate transformation.
00528 
00529                             for(int k = 0; k < n; k++)
00530                             {
00531                                 h = V[k][i + 1];
00532                                 V[k][i + 1] = s * V[k][i] + c * h;
00533                                 V[k][i] = c * V[k][i] - s * h;
00534                             }
00535                         }
00536 
00537                         p = (-s) * s2 * c3 * el1 * e[l] / dl1;
00538                         e[l] = s * p;
00539                         d[l] = c * p;
00540 
00541                         // Check for convergence.
00542                     }
00543                     while(Math.Abs(e[l]) > eps * tst1);
00544                 }
00545 
00546                 d[l] = d[l] + f;
00547                 e[l] = 0.0;
00548             }
00549 
00550             // Sort eigenvalues and corresponding vectors.
00551 
00552             for(int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++)
00553             {
00554                 int k = i;
00555                 double p = d[i];
00556                 for(int j = i + 1; j < n; j++)
00557                 {
00558                     if(d[j] < p)
00559                     {
00560                         k = j;
00561                         p = d[j];
00562                     }
00563                 }
00564 
00565                 if(k != i)
00566                 {
00567                     d[k] = d[i];
00568                     d[i] = p;
00569                     for(int j = 0; j < n; j++)
00570                     {
00571                         p = V[j][i];
00572                         V[j][i] = V[j][k];
00573                         V[j][k] = p;
00574                     }
00575                 }
00576             }
00577         }
00578 
00582         void
00583         NonsymmetricReduceToHessenberg()
00584         {
00585             // This is derived from the Algol procedures orthes and ortran,
00586             // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
00587             // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
00588             // Fortran subroutines in EISPACK.
00589 
00590             int low = 0;
00591             int high = n - 1;
00592 
00593             double[] ort = new double[n];
00594 
00595             for(int m = low + 1; m <= high - 1; m++)
00596             {
00597 
00598                 // Scale column.
00599 
00600                 double scale = 0.0;
00601                 for(int i = m; i <= high; i++)
00602                 {
00603                     scale = scale + Math.Abs(H[i][m - 1]);
00604                 }
00605 
00606                 if(scale != 0.0)
00607                 {
00608 
00609                     // Compute Householder transformation.
00610 
00611                     double h = 0.0;
00612                     for(int i = high; i >= m; i--)
00613                     {
00614                         ort[i] = H[i][m - 1] / scale;
00615                         h += ort[i] * ort[i];
00616                     }
00617 
00618                     double g = Math.Sqrt(h);
00619                     if(ort[m] > 0)
00620                     {
00621                         g = -g;
00622                     }
00623 
00624                     h = h - ort[m] * g;
00625                     ort[m] = ort[m] - g;
00626 
00627                     // Apply Householder similarity transformation
00628                     // H = (I-u*u'/h)*H*(I-u*u')/h)
00629 
00630                     for(int j = m; j < n; j++)
00631                     {
00632                         double f = 0.0;
00633                         for(int i = high; i >= m; i--)
00634                         {
00635                             f += ort[i] * H[i][j];
00636                         }
00637 
00638                         f = f / h;
00639                         for(int i = m; i <= high; i++)
00640                         {
00641                             H[i][j] -= f * ort[i];
00642                         }
00643                     }
00644 
00645                     for(int i = 0; i <= high; i++)
00646                     {
00647                         double f = 0.0;
00648                         for(int j = high; j >= m; j--)
00649                         {
00650                             f += ort[j] * H[i][j];
00651                         }
00652 
00653                         f = f / h;
00654                         for(int j = m; j <= high; j++)
00655                         {
00656                             H[i][j] -= f * ort[j];
00657                         }
00658                     }
00659 
00660                     ort[m] = scale * ort[m];
00661                     H[m][m - 1] = scale * g;
00662                 }
00663             }
00664 
00665             // Accumulate transformations (Algol's ortran).
00666 
00667             for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00668             {
00669                 for(int j = 0; j < n; j++)
00670                 {
00671                     V[i][j] = (i == j ? 1.0 : 0.0);
00672                 }
00673             }
00674 
00675             for(int m = high - 1; m >= low + 1; m--)
00676             {
00677                 if(H[m][m - 1] != 0.0)
00678                 {
00679                     for(int i = m + 1; i <= high; i++)
00680                     {
00681                         ort[i] = H[i][m - 1];
00682                     }
00683 
00684                     for(int j = m; j <= high; j++)
00685                     {
00686                         double g = 0.0;
00687                         for(int i = m; i <= high; i++)
00688                         {
00689                             g += ort[i] * V[i][j];
00690                         }
00691 
00692                         // Double division avoids possible underflow
00693                         g = (g / ort[m]) / H[m][m - 1];
00694                         for(int i = m; i <= high; i++)
00695                         {
00696                             V[i][j] += g * ort[i];
00697                         }
00698                     }
00699                 }
00700             }
00701         }
00702 
00706         void
00707         NonsymmetricReduceHessenberToRealSchur()
00708         {
00709             // This is derived from the Algol procedure hqr2,
00710             // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
00711             // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
00712             // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
00713 
00714             // Initialize
00715 
00716             int nn = this.n;
00717             int n = nn - 1;
00718             int low = 0;
00719             int high = nn - 1;
00720             double eps = Number.PositiveRelativeAccuracy;
00721             double exshift = 0.0;
00722             double p = 0, q = 0, r = 0, s = 0, z = 0, t, w, x, y;
00723 
00724             // Store roots isolated by balanc and compute matrix norm
00725 
00726             double norm = 0.0;
00727             for(int i = 0; i < nn; i++)
00728             {
00729                 if(i < low | i > high)
00730                 {
00731                     d[i] = H[i][i];
00732                     e[i] = 0.0;
00733                 }
00734 
00735                 for(int j = Math.Max(i - 1, 0); j < nn; j++)
00736                 {
00737                     norm = norm + Math.Abs(H[i][j]);
00738                 }
00739             }
00740 
00741             // Outer loop over eigenvalue index
00742 
00743             int iter = 0;
00744             while(n >= low)
00745             {
00746 
00747                 // Look for single small sub-diagonal element
00748 
00749                 int l = n;
00750                 while(l > low)
00751                 {
00752                     s = Math.Abs(H[l - 1][l - 1]) + Math.Abs(H[l][l]);
00753 
00754                     if(s == 0.0)
00755                     {
00756                         s = norm;
00757                     }
00758 
00759                     if(Math.Abs(H[l][l - 1]) < eps * s)
00760                     {
00761                         break;
00762                     }
00763 
00764                     l--;
00765                 }
00766 
00767                 // Check for convergence
00768                 // One root found
00769 
00770                 if(l == n)
00771                 {
00772                     H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
00773                     d[n] = H[n][n];
00774                     e[n] = 0.0;
00775                     n--;
00776                     iter = 0;
00777 
00778                     // Two roots found
00779                 }
00780                 else if(l == n - 1)
00781                 {
00782                     w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
00783                     p = (H[n - 1][n - 1] - H[n][n]) / 2.0;
00784                     q = p * p + w;
00785                     z = Math.Sqrt(Math.Abs(q));
00786                     H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
00787                     H[n - 1][n - 1] = H[n - 1][n - 1] + exshift;
00788                     x = H[n][n];
00789 
00790                     // Real pair
00791 
00792                     if(q >= 0)
00793                     {
00794                         if(p >= 0)
00795                         {
00796                             z = p + z;
00797                         }
00798                         else
00799                         {
00800                             z = p - z;
00801                         }
00802 
00803                         d[n - 1] = x + z;
00804 
00805                         d[n] = d[n - 1];
00806                         if(z != 0.0)
00807                         {
00808                             d[n] = x - w / z;
00809                         }
00810 
00811                         e[n - 1] = 0.0;
00812                         e[n] = 0.0;
00813                         x = H[n][n - 1];
00814                         s = Math.Abs(x) + Math.Abs(z);
00815                         p = x / s;
00816                         q = z / s;
00817                         r = Math.Sqrt(p * p + q * q);
00818                         p = p / r;
00819                         q = q / r;
00820 
00821                         // Row modification
00822 
00823                         for(int j = n - 1; j < nn; j++)
00824                         {
00825                             z = H[n - 1][j];
00826                             H[n - 1][j] = q * z + p * H[n][j];
00827                             H[n][j] = q * H[n][j] - p * z;
00828                         }
00829 
00830                         // Column modification
00831 
00832                         for(int i = 0; i <= n; i++)
00833                         {
00834                             z = H[i][n - 1];
00835                             H[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * H[i][n];
00836                             H[i][n] = q * H[i][n] - p * z;
00837                         }
00838 
00839                         // Accumulate transformations
00840 
00841                         for(int i = low; i <= high; i++)
00842                         {
00843                             z = V[i][n - 1];
00844                             V[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * V[i][n];
00845                             V[i][n] = q * V[i][n] - p * z;
00846                         }
00847 
00848                         // Complex pair
00849                     }
00850                     else
00851                     {
00852                         d[n - 1] = x + p;
00853                         d[n] = x + p;
00854                         e[n - 1] = z;
00855                         e[n] = -z;
00856                     }
00857 
00858                     n = n - 2;
00859                     iter = 0;
00860 
00861                     // No convergence yet
00862                 }
00863                 else
00864                 {
00865 
00866                     // Form shift
00867 
00868                     x = H[n][n];
00869                     y = 0.0;
00870                     w = 0.0;
00871                     if(l < n)
00872                     {
00873                         y = H[n - 1][n - 1];
00874                         w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
00875                     }
00876 
00877                     // Wilkinson's original ad hoc shift
00878 
00879                     if(iter == 10)
00880                     {
00881                         exshift += x;
00882                         for(int i = low; i <= n; i++)
00883                         {
00884                             H[i][i] -= x;
00885                         }
00886 
00887                         s = Math.Abs(H[n][n - 1]) + Math.Abs(H[n - 1][n - 2]);
00888                         x = y = 0.75 * s;
00889                         w = (-0.4375) * s * s;
00890                     }
00891 
00892                     // MATLAB's new ad hoc shift
00893 
00894                     if(iter == 30)
00895                     {
00896                         s = (y - x) / 2.0;
00897                         s = s * s + w;
00898                         if(s > 0)
00899                         {
00900                             s = Math.Sqrt(s);
00901                             if(y < x)
00902                             {
00903                                 s = -s;
00904                             }
00905 
00906                             s = x - w / ((y - x) / 2.0 + s);
00907                             for(int i = low; i <= n; i++)
00908                             {
00909                                 H[i][i] -= s;
00910                             }
00911 
00912                             exshift += s;
00913                             x = y = w = 0.964;
00914                         }
00915                     }
00916 
00917                     iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
00918 
00919                     // Look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements
00920 
00921                     int m = n - 2;
00922                     while(m >= l)
00923                     {
00924                         z = H[m][m];
00925                         r = x - z;
00926                         s = y - z;
00927                         p = (r * s - w) / H[m + 1][m] + H[m][m + 1];
00928                         q = H[m + 1][m + 1] - z - r - s;
00929                         r = H[m + 2][m + 1];
00930                         s = Math.Abs(p) + Math.Abs(q) + Math.Abs(r);
00931                         p = p / s;
00932                         q = q / s;
00933                         r = r / s;
00934 
00935                         if(m == l)
00936                         {
00937                             break;
00938                         }
00939 
00940                         if(Math.Abs(H[m][m - 1]) * (Math.Abs(q) + Math.Abs(r)) < eps * (Math.Abs(p) * (Math.Abs(H[m - 1][m - 1]) + Math.Abs(z) + Math.Abs(H[m + 1][m + 1]))))
00941                         {
00942                             break;
00943                         }
00944 
00945                         m--;
00946                     }
00947 
00948                     for(int i = m + 2; i <= n; i++)
00949                     {
00950                         H[i][i - 2] = 0.0;
00951                         if(i > m + 2)
00952                         {
00953                             H[i][i - 3] = 0.0;
00954                         }
00955                     }
00956 
00957                     // Double QR step involving rows l:n and columns m:n
00958 
00959                     for(int k = m; k <= n - 1; k++)
00960                     {
00961                         bool notlast = (k != n - 1);
00962 
00963                         if(k != m)
00964                         {
00965                             p = H[k][k - 1];
00966                             q = H[k + 1][k - 1];
00967                             r = (notlast ? H[k + 2][k - 1] : 0.0);
00968                             x = Math.Abs(p) + Math.Abs(q) + Math.Abs(r);
00969                             if(x != 0.0)
00970                             {
00971                                 p = p / x;
00972                                 q = q / x;
00973                                 r = r / x;
00974                             }
00975                         }
00976 
00977                         if(x == 0.0)
00978                         {
00979                             break;
00980                         }
00981 
00982                         s = Math.Sqrt(p * p + q * q + r * r);
00983                         if(p < 0)
00984                         {
00985                             s = -s;
00986                         }
00987 
00988                         if(s != 0.0)
00989                         {
00990                             if(k != m)
00991                             {
00992                                 H[k][k - 1] = (-s) * x;
00993                             }
00994                             else if(l != m)
00995                             {
00996                                 H[k][k - 1] = -H[k][k - 1];
00997                             }
00998 
00999                             p = p + s;
01000                             x = p / s;
01001                             y = q / s;
01002                             z = r / s;
01003                             q = q / p;
01004                             r = r / p;
01005 
01006                             // Row modification
01007 
01008                             for(int j = k; j < nn; j++)
01009                             {
01010                                 p = H[k][j] + q * H[k + 1][j];
01011 
01012                                 if(notlast)
01013                                 {
01014                                     p = p + r * H[k + 2][j];
01015                                     H[k + 2][j] = H[k + 2][j] - p * z;
01016                                 }
01017 
01018                                 H[k][j] = H[k][j] - p * x;
01019                                 H[k + 1][j] = H[k + 1][j] - p * y;
01020                             }
01021 
01022                             // Column modification
01023 
01024                             for(int i = 0; i <= Math.Min(n, k + 3); i++)
01025                             {
01026                                 double[] Hi = H[i];
01027                                 p = x * Hi[k] + y * Hi[k + 1];
01028 
01029                                 if(notlast)
01030                                 {
01031                                     p = p + z * Hi[k + 2];
01032                                     Hi[k + 2] = Hi[k + 2] - p * r;
01033                                 }
01034 
01035                                 Hi[k] = Hi[k] - p;
01036                                 Hi[k + 1] = Hi[k + 1] - p * q;
01037                             }
01038 
01039                             // Accumulate transformations
01040 
01041                             for(int i = low; i <= high; i++)
01042                             {
01043                                 double[] Vi = V[i];
01044                                 p = x * Vi[k] + y * Vi[k + 1];
01045 
01046                                 if(notlast)
01047                                 {
01048                                     p = p + z * Vi[k + 2];
01049                                     Vi[k + 2] = Vi[k + 2] - p * r;
01050                                 }
01051 
01052                                 Vi[k] = Vi[k] - p;
01053                                 Vi[k + 1] = Vi[k + 1] - p * q;
01054                             }
01055                         } // (s != 0)
01056                     } // k loop
01057                 } // check convergence
01058             } // while (n >= low)
01059 
01060             // Backsubstitute to find vectors of upper triangular form
01061 
01062             if(norm == 0.0)
01063             {
01064                 return;
01065             }
01066 
01067             for(n = nn - 1; n >= 0; n--)
01068             {
01069                 p = d[n];
01070                 q = e[n];
01071 
01072                 // Real vector
01073 
01074                 if(q == 0.0)
01075                 {
01076                     int l = n;
01077                     H[n][n] = 1.0;
01078                     for(int i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--)
01079                     {
01080                         w = H[i][i] - p;
01081                         r = 0.0;
01082                         for(int j = l; j <= n; j++)
01083                         {
01084                             r = r + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
01085                         }
01086 
01087                         if(e[i] < 0.0)
01088                         {
01089                             z = w;
01090                             s = r;
01091                         }
01092                         else
01093                         {
01094                             l = i;
01095                             if(e[i] == 0.0)
01096                             {
01097                                 if(w != 0.0)
01098                                 {
01099                                     H[i][n] = (-r) / w;
01100                                 }
01101                                 else
01102                                 {
01103                                     H[i][n] = (-r) / (eps * norm);
01104                                 }
01105 
01106                                 // Solve real equations
01107                             }
01108                             else
01109                             {
01110                                 x = H[i][i + 1];
01111                                 y = H[i + 1][i];
01112                                 q = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i];
01113                                 t = (x * s - z * r) / q;
01114                                 H[i][n] = t;
01115                                 if(Math.Abs(x) > Math.Abs(z))
01116                                 {
01117                                     H[i + 1][n] = (-r - w * t) / x;
01118                                 }
01119                                 else
01120                                 {
01121                                     H[i + 1][n] = (-s - y * t) / z;
01122                                 }
01123                             }
01124 
01125                             // Overflow control
01126 
01127                             t = Math.Abs(H[i][n]);
01128                             if((eps * t) * t > 1)
01129                             {
01130                                 for(int j = i; j <= n; j++)
01131                                 {
01132                                     H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
01133                                 }
01134                             }
01135                         }
01136                     }
01137 
01138                     // Complex vector
01139                 }
01140                 else if(q < 0)
01141                 {
01142                     int l = n - 1;
01143 
01144                     // Last vector component imaginary so matrix is triangular
01145 
01146                     if(Math.Abs(H[n][n - 1]) > Math.Abs(H[n - 1][n]))
01147                     {
01148                         H[n - 1][n - 1] = q / H[n][n - 1];
01149                         H[n - 1][n] = (-(H[n][n] - p)) / H[n][n - 1];
01150                     }
01151                     else
01152                     {
01153                         cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
01154                         H[n - 1][n - 1] = cdivr;
01155                         H[n - 1][n] = cdivi;
01156                     }
01157 
01158                     H[n][n - 1] = 0.0;
01159                     H[n][n] = 1.0;
01160                     for(int i = n - 2; i >= 0; i--)
01161                     {
01162                         double ra, sa, vr, vi;
01163                         ra = 0.0;
01164                         sa = 0.0;
01165                         for(int j = l; j <= n; j++)
01166                         {
01167                             ra = ra + H[i][j] * H[j][n - 1];
01168                             sa = sa + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
01169                         }
01170 
01171                         w = H[i][i] - p;
01172 
01173                         if(e[i] < 0.0)
01174                         {
01175                             z = w;
01176                             r = ra;
01177                             s = sa;
01178                         }
01179                         else
01180                         {
01181                             l = i;
01182                             if(e[i] == 0.0)
01183                             {
01184                                 cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
01185                                 H[i][n - 1] = cdivr;
01186                                 H[i][n] = cdivi;
01187                             }
01188                             else
01189                             {
01190 
01191                                 // Solve complex equations
01192 
01193                                 x = H[i][i + 1];
01194                                 y = H[i + 1][i];
01195                                 
01196                                 vr = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i] - q * q;
01197                                 vi = (d[i] - p) * 2.0 * q;
01198                                 if((vr == 0.0) && (vi == 0.0))
01199                                 {
01200                                     vr = eps * norm * (Math.Abs(w) + Math.Abs(q) + Math.Abs(x) + Math.Abs(y) + Math.Abs(z));
01201                                 }
01202 
01203                                 cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
01204                                 H[i][n - 1] = cdivr;
01205                                 H[i][n] = cdivi;
01206                                 if(Math.Abs(x) > (Math.Abs(z) + Math.Abs(q)))
01207                                 {
01208                                     H[i + 1][n - 1] = (-ra - w * H[i][n - 1] + q * H[i][n]) / x;
01209                                     H[i + 1][n] = (-sa - w * H[i][n] - q * H[i][n - 1]) / x;
01210                                 }
01211                                 else
01212                                 {
01213                                     cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
01214                                     H[i + 1][n - 1] = cdivr;
01215                                     H[i + 1][n] = cdivi;
01216                                 }
01217                             }
01218 
01219                             // Overflow control
01220 
01221                             t = Math.Max(Math.Abs(H[i][n - 1]), Math.Abs(H[i][n]));
01222                             if((eps * t) * t > 1)
01223                             {
01224                                 for(int j = i; j <= n; j++)
01225                                 {
01226                                     H[j][n - 1] = H[j][n - 1] / t;
01227                                     H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
01228                                 }
01229                             }
01230                         }
01231                     }
01232                 }
01233             }
01234 
01235             // Vectors of isolated roots
01236 
01237             for(int i = 0; i < nn; i++)
01238             {
01239                 if(i < low | i > high)
01240                 {
01241                     for(int j = i; j < nn; j++)
01242                     {
01243                         V[i][j] = H[i][j];
01244                     }
01245                 }
01246             }
01247 
01248             // Back transformation to get eigenvectors of original matrix
01249 
01250             for(int j = nn - 1; j >= low; j--)
01251             {
01252                 for(int i = low; i <= high; i++)
01253                 {
01254                     z = 0.0;
01255                     for(int k = low; k <= Math.Min(j, high); k++)
01256                     {
01257                         z = z + V[i][k] * H[k][j];
01258                     }
01259 
01260                     V[i][j] = z;
01261                 }
01262             }
01263         }
01264 
01268         void
01269         cdiv(
01270             double xr,
01271             double xi,
01272             double yr,
01273             double yi
01274             )
01275         {
01276             // TODO (cdr, 2008-03-11): Refactor
01277 
01278             double r, d;
01279             if(Math.Abs(yr) > Math.Abs(yi))
01280             {
01281                 r = yi / yr;
01282                 d = yr + r * yi;
01283                 cdivr = (xr + r * xi) / d;
01284                 cdivi = (xi - r * xr) / d;
01285             }
01286             else
01287             {
01288                 r = yr / yi;
01289                 d = yi + r * yr;
01290                 cdivr = (r * xr + xi) / d;
01291                 cdivi = (r * xi - xr) / d;
01292             }
01293         }
01294     }
01295 }
